jparsec.astronomy

Class Star

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.astronomy.Star

  • public class Star
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that performs some simple calculations about star properties, including simple photometry and extinction.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS
      The set of luminosity classes.

      • schwartzchildRadius

        public static double schwartzchildRadius(double M)
        Obtains Schwartzchild radius for an object of certain mass. If the radius is lower than this value, then the object is a black hole.
        Parameters:
        M - Mass in solar masses.
        Returns:
        Radius in solar radii.

      • stellarWindMass

        public static double stellarWindMass(double n,
                     double v,
                     double r)
        Obtain wind mass lost ratio in solar masses by year. The effect in stellar evolution is negligible except in high mass stars.
        Parameters:
        n - Proton density in cm^-3 at certain distance from the star. Typical value of 7 for the Sun.
        v - Proton velocity in km/s at the same distance. Typical value of 500 for the Sun.
        r - The distance where n and v are measured in AU. Typical value of 1 for the Sun.
        Returns:
        Mass lose ratio in solar masses by year. Typical value of 5E-14 Msun/year for the Sun.

      • kepler3rdLawOfMasses

        public static double kepler3rdLawOfMasses(double a,
                          double P)
        Returns the mass of an object using Kepler's third law.
        Parameters:
        a - Distance of a measure in AU.
        P - Orbital period at that position in years.
        Returns:
        Mass in solar masses.

      • blackBodyFlux

        public static double blackBodyFlux(double T)
        Obtain total flux of a black body at certain temperature.
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature.
        Returns:
        Flux in W/m^2.

      • tullyFisherRelation

        public static double tullyFisherRelation(double v)
        Applies Tully-Fisher relation for obtaining the total luminosity of a spiral galaxy. This method calculates the luminosity ratio compared to the Milky Way and returned this value multiplied by 4.5E10 (the total luminosity of the Milky Way in Lsun as measured by Portinari 2005). The luminosity ratio is computed by means of the absolute magnitude of Milky Way and the other galaxy, computed with M = -9.5 log10 (v) + 2, using v = 250 km/s (Turner 2013) for the Milky Way.

        Al alternative approach for this result is given with the method to compute the luminosity using the Fabber-Jackson relation, that can also be applied to spirals.

        Parameters:
        v - Rotation velocity in km/s in the outer galaxy.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solar units.

      • fabberJacksonRelation

        public static double fabberJacksonRelation(double sigma)
        Applies Fabber-Jackson relation for obtaining the luminosity of an elliptical galaxy. This relation is a power law with index 4.55, calibrated using the Milky Way with a total luminosity of 4.5E10 Lsun (Portinari 2005), and circular velocity (or dispersion in case of ellipticals) of 250 km/s (Turner 2013). This method can also be applied as the Tully Fisher relation by providing the circular velocity instead of velocity dispersion.
        Parameters:
        sigma - Velocity dispersion in km/s in the inner region.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solar units.

      • sechterRelation

        public static double sechterRelation(double L,
                     double alfa)
        Calculates Sechter luminosity function.
        Parameters:
        L - Luminosity in solar units.
        alfa - Slope parameter.
        Returns:
        Number of objects per unit of luminosity, dN/dL.

      • galacticRedshift

        public static double galacticRedshift(LocationElement loc)
        Obtains the contribution of the motion of the Sun in the galaxy to the redshift. It is supposed that the Sun moves at 250 km/s (see Turner 2013) towards a direction l = 90º, b = 0º, in galactic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        loc - Galactic coordination of the source.
        Returns:
        Contribution of the Sun movement in the galaxy to the redshift towards the given direction.

        Returns:
        Wavelength in m.

      • getSurfaceBrightness

        public static double getSurfaceBrightness(double m,
                          double r)
        Obtains surface brightness of an object.
        Parameters:
        m - Magnitude.
        r - Radius in arcseconds. If the object is not circular, an equivalent value can be given so that the area (PI * r^2) in equal to the area of the object in the sky.
        Returns:
        Brightness in mag/arcsecond^2, or 0 if radius is 0.

      • getLuminosityFromMassLuminosityRelation

        public static double getLuminosityFromMassLuminosityRelation(double mass)
        Obtain the luminosity using the mass-luminosity relation for main sequence stars. Formula used depends on if the mass is lower than 0.43, lower than 2, and lower than 20 or not. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass%E2%80%93luminosity_relation for the different formulae using Cassisi (2005) and Duric (2004).
        Parameters:
        mass - Mass in solar units.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solar units.

      • getMassFromMassLuminosityRelation

        public static double getMassFromMassLuminosityRelation(double luminosity)
        Obtain the luminosity using the mass-luminosity relation for main sequence stars.
        Parameters:
        luminosity - Luminosity in solar units.
        Returns:
        Mass in solar units.

      • getStarMagnitude

        public static double getStarMagnitude(double flux,
                      double skyBackground,
                      double fluxComparison,
                      double skyBackgroundComparison,
                      double magComparison)
        Obtains the magnitude of a star given the flux on it, the background, and the same properties (including magnitude) of a comparison star close to it.
        Parameters:
        flux - Flux of the star.
        skyBackground - Flux of the background.
        fluxComparison - Flux of a comparison star.
        skyBackgroundComparison - Sky background around comparison star.
        magComparison - Magnitude of a comparison star.
        Returns:
        Magnitude of the star.

      • impactCrater

        public static double[] impactCrater(double impactorDiameter,
                    double impactorDensity,
                    double impactorVelocity,
                    double zenithAngle)
        Calculates the size of an impact crater.
        Parameters:
        impactorDiameter - Diameter of the impactor in m.
        impactorDensity - Density of the impactor in kg/m^3. Usual value is 2000.
        impactorVelocity - Velocity of the impactor in km/s. Usual value is 50.
        zenithAngle - Zenith angle of the impactor trajectory in degrees.
        Returns:
        Diameter and depth of the impact crater in m.

      • getExtinction

        public static double getExtinction(double z,
                   double h,
                   int quality)
        Calculates the extinction in magnitudes due to Earth's atmosphere.
        Parameters:
        z - Zenith angle, in radians. Extinction is set to 0 if this value is above PI/2.0.
        h - Height above sea level, in km.
        quality - The 'quality' of the night, from 0 (summer-like conditions) to 10 (winter-like conditions).
        Returns:
        Extinction in magnitudes.

      • getStarMagnitude

        public static double getStarMagnitude(double fluxIn,
                      double fluxReference,
                      double magReference)
        Performs a simple photometry measurement.
        Parameters:
        fluxIn - Flux of the input star, background subtracted.
        fluxReference - Flux of a reference star, background subtracted.
        magReference - Magnitude of reference star.
        Returns:
        Magnitude of input star.

      • cosmology

        public static double[] cosmology(double H0,
                 double WM,
                 double WV,
                 double z)
        Based on the cosmology calculator by Edward L. Wright, javascript version at http://www.astro.ucla.edu/~wright/CosmoCalc.html. For an open universe set WV to 0 and WM < 1. For a flat universe to WV = 1.0 - WM.
        Parameters:
        H0 - Hubble constant, recommended value is 71 km/(s Mpc).
        WM - Omega-0 (omega of matter), recommended value is 0.27.
        WV - Omega-vacuum or lambda (due to consmological constant), recommended value is 0.73.
        z - Redshift of the observed object, from 0 (local universe).
        Returns:
        A set of 11 values containing:
        Time elapsed from Big Bang (age of universe).
        The age of the universe at input redshift z.
        The light travel time from the object at z.
        The comoving radial distance, which goes into Hubble's law, in Mpc and Gly (2 values).
        The comoving volume within redshift z in Gpc^3.
        The angular size distance in Mpc and Gly (2 values).
        Scale factor when imaging the object, in kpc/".
        The luminosity distance in Mpc and Gly (2 values).

      • getRedshiftFromLightTravelTime

        public static double getRedshiftFromLightTravelTime(double H0,
                                    double WM,
                                    double WV,
                                    double tltt)
        Based on the cosmology calculator by Edward L. Wright, javascript version at http://www.astro.ucla.edu/~wright/CosmoCalc.html. For an open universe set WV to 0 and WM < 1. For a flat universe to WV = 1.0 - WM.
        Parameters:
        H0 - Hubble constant, recommended value is 71 km/(s Mpc).
        WM - Omega-0 (omega of matter), recommended value is 0.27.
        WV - Omega-vacuum or lambda (due to consmological constant), recommended value is 0.73.
        tltt - Light travel time from the object.
        Returns:
        Redshift of the object to be used in cosmology(double, double, double, double).

      • getBlackBodyBminusV

        public static double getBlackBodyBminusV(double T)
        Returns the B-V color index of a perfect black body.
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature in K.
        Returns:
        B-V.

      • getBlackBodyT

        public static double getBlackBodyT(double BminusV)
        Returns the effective temperature of a perfect black body.
        Parameters:
        BminusV - The B-V color index.
        Returns:
        The effective temperature in K.

      • getStarBminusV

        public static double getStarBminusV(double T,
                    Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                             throws JPARSECException
        Returns the B-V color index of a star. Based on Flower P.J. Astrophys. J. 469, 355 (1996) and A. Cox (1982).
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature in K. NaN is returned in case no solution is possible (T > 56000 or T < 3000) and luminosity class is main sequence, otherwise an error can be thrown.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        B-V.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getStarTeff

        public static double getStarTeff(double BminusV,
                 Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the effective temperature of a star. Based on Flower P.J., Astrophys. J. 469, 355 (1996), and Cox (1982).
        Parameters:
        BminusV - The B-V color index.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        The effective temperature in K. NaN is returned in case no solution is found (B-V < -0.35 or B-V > 1.80) and luminosity class is main sequence, otherwise an error can be thrown.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getStarBolometricCorrection

        public static double getStarBolometricCorrection(double T,
                                 Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                                          throws JPARSECException
        Returns the bolometric correction for a star, so that Mbol = Mv + BC. Based on Flower P.J. Astrophys. J. 469, 355 (1996) and Cox (1982).
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature in K.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        BC. NaN is returned in case no solution is possible (T > 56000 or T < 3000) and luminosity class is main sequence, otherwise an error can be thrown.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getStarLuminosityUsingBolometricCorrection

        public static double getStarLuminosityUsingBolometricCorrection(double mv,
                                                double T,
                                                Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                                                         throws JPARSECException
        Obtains stellar bolometric luminosity for a star in the main sequence, using the bolometric correction and the bolometric magnitude of the Sun = 4.75.
        Parameters:
        mv - Star absolute magnitude.
        T - Effective temperature in K.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solar units.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getStarLuminosityUsingBolometricCorrection

        public static double getStarLuminosityUsingBolometricCorrection(double T,
                                                Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                                                         throws JPARSECException
        Obtains the bolometric luminosity of a star in the main sequence. This method only needs the effective temperature, which is used to compute the star B-V color and then its absolute magnitude. Then the bolometric correction is used to compute the luminosity relative to the Sun.
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature in K for the star in the main sequence.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solar units.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs, but should never happen.

      • getStarAbsoluteMagnitude

        public static double getStarAbsoluteMagnitude(double BminusV,
                              Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                                       throws JPARSECException
        Returns the absolute magnitude of a star given its B-V color index. Based on Flower (1996), Pickles (1998), and Cox (1982).
        Parameters:
        BminusV - B-V.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        Absolute magnitude. NaN is returned for a B-V out of range -0.35 to 1.80 and luminosity class main sequence, otherwise an error can be thrown.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Should never happen.

      • getStarBminusVFromMv

        public static double getStarBminusVFromMv(double Mv,
                          Star.LUMINOSITY_CLASS lclass)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Returns the B-V given the absolute magnitude of the star. A table is used to compute the best B-V by interpolating.
        Parameters:
        Mv - Absolute magnitude.
        lclass - The luminosity class for the star.
        Returns:
        B-V. NaN is returned for an absolute magnitude out of range from -6.2 to 16.5 and luminosity class main sequence, otherwise an error can be thrown.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Should never happen.

      • getSpectralType

        public static java.lang.String getSpectralType(double T,
                               int ndec)
                                        throws JPARSECException
        Returns the spectral type for a star in the main sequence given its effective temperature.
        Parameters:
        T - Effective temperature in K.
        ndec - Number of decimal positions.
        Returns:
        Spectral type as character + number, for instance O5. Null in case T is out of range 3000 to 56000. In case ndec is greater than 0, a possible output for ndec = 1 would be O5.1.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getEffectiveTemperature

        public static double getEffectiveTemperature(java.lang.String sp)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the spectral type for a star in the main sequence given its effective temperature.
        Parameters:
        sp - Spectral type, one of OBAFGKM plus a number.
        Returns:
        Effective temperature in K.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • CefeidPeriodLuminosity

        public double CefeidPeriodLuminosity(double period)
        Applies the period-luminosity relation for Cepheids: L (Lsun) = 1.15 log10 P + 2.47.
        Parameters:
        period - The period in days.
        Returns:
        Luminosity in solaru nits.

      • virialTheorem

        public static double virialTheorem(double sigma,
                   double r)
        Applies the Virial Theorem that relates the velocity dispersion in a set of sources (cluster of galaxies, globular cluster, ...) within a given radius with the total mass.
        Parameters:
        sigma - Velocity dispersion in km/s.
        r - Radius in pc.
        Returns:
        Mass in solar masses.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
